results.title: The Wizard from Oz - James Morrison
results.creator_credit: John Ossher, Don Featherstone and Don Featherstone Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Creative Spirits Series”.
A personal perspective on the life and music of jazz multi-instrumentalist, James Morrison. He heads us through the documentary in a series of statements derived from interviews at a variety of locations - from an empty jazz club in the afternoon, to a studio in New York, seated among some of the finest international jazz musicians of the last fifty years. We encounter his family, his musical colleagues, friends and critics and learn about Jazz and about James Morrison: musician, composer, dare-devil and philosopher, and we listen to his music.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Ossher, Don Featherstone and Don Featherstone Productions

results.title: Back injury
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Your life in their hands”.
Many people suffer from back pain at some stage of their lives. This film studies the option that one man chose in order to try to relieve his pain.

results.title: The Trials of Zanzibar
results.creator_credit: Alan Segal, Stephen Clarke and Granada International Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”
Reports on political trials being held in Zanzibar where the accused are refused defence counsel and the prosecution admits that some of the evidence was obtained under torture. Includes an interview with Zanzibar’s Attorney-General and Aboud Jumbe, Zanzibar’s Head of State

results.title: Maggie Mcgowan
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Your life in their hands”.
Part of series of medical films produced at a London hospital. The camera follows the surgeons operating on Mrs. McGowan as they introduce remarkable techniques in modern medicine to save her from cancer of the bowel.
results.description:
Episode of Series “Your life in their hands”.
Part of series of medical films produced at a London hospital. The camera follows the surgeons operating on Mrs. McGowan as they introduce remarkable techniques in modern medicine to save her from cancer of the bowel.

results.title: Trial 1001
results.creator_credit: David Boulton and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”
Trade unions are illegal in Spain. A meeting had been arranged in a monastery, but ten men were brutally arrested as they arrived. Their relations describe the conditions of Franco’s dictatorship and the humiliation the men undergo in fighting for a basic human right.

results.title: Tip of the iceberg
results.creator_credit: Steve Morrison and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”
The problem of toxic industrial waste poses environmental problems around the world. This film investigates the dangers of the dumping of tons of toxic waste on an industrial tip near the Avon Age fortress of Sutton Walls, Hertfordshire, and near farmland in Matlock, Derbyshire.
